alert.note: Alert for Cape Decision to Salisbury Sound Coastal Area; Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area; Dixon Entrance to Cape Decision Coastal Area; Eastern Baranof Island and Southern Admiralty Island; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Lynn Canal; Inner Channels from Kupreanof Island to Etolin Island; Juneau Borough and Northern Admiralty Island; Misty Fjords; Salisbury Sound to Cape Fairweather Coastal Area; Southern Inner Channels; Taiya Inlet and Klondike Highway (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 2:24PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...Wintry Weather for Wednesday and Significant Storm Friday... A fast moving low will track across the AK Panhandle from North to South on Wednesday. This system will produce 1 to 2 inches of snow along coastal and southern areas and 2 to 4 inches for the central and northern regions. In addition as temperatures warm snow will likely mix or change over to rain for coastal and southern locations with the possibility of a brief period of freezing rain. A strong system is expected to move over the entire Panhandle Friday before moving out on Saturday. This system may produce 6 to 12 inches of snow by New Years Day. Behind this system very cold air will move in for next week with near record breaking low temperatures along with strong outflow winds. Please stay tuned to www.weather.gov, NOAA Weather radio, or your favorite local weather news source for updates on this situation.
